message.content:
cs.IT, cs.ITP, cs.SI, cs.MM, cs.ITC. 

The paper deals with information theory and specifically with the entropy power inequality (EPI), which is a fundamental result in information theory. Therefore, cs.IT (Information Theory) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also involves mathematical proofs and connections to functional equations, which suggests that it could also belong to cs.ITP (Information Theory and Probability) and cs.MM (Mathematical Methods). Additionally, the paper deals with entropy and information measures, which could place it in cs.SI (Signal Processing and Information Theory) and cs.ITC (Information Theory and Coding).
